skills.name: slim-changelog
skills.description: Create and maintain human-readable changelogs for software projects using Keep a Changelog standards

skills.name: slim-code-of-conduct
skills.description: Create and implement code of conduct and collaboration policies using Contributor Covenant standards, with specialized templates for scientific research environments and academic citation
skills.example: Add a code of conduct with citation guidelines for scientific projects

skills.name: slim-container-vulnerability-scanning
skills.description: Implement Grype-based container and dependency vulnerability scanning with automated pre-commit hooks
skills.example: Add Grype-based container vulnerability scanning to this project

skills.name: slim-continuous-testing
skills.description: Implement comprehensive testing strategies with documentation and automation templates for static analysis, security scanning, and code quality checks
skills.example: Set up pre-commit hooks for automated testing and code quality checks

skills.name: slim-contributing-guide
skills.description: Create comprehensive contributing guides for open source projects with workflow guidance and customizable templates
skills.example: Generate a CONTRIBUTING.md guide for this repository

skills.name: slim-executive-summary
skills.description: Generate comprehensive executive summaries from workspace communication files using AI analysis with automatic context discovery
skills.example: Generate an executive summary from the 2024-12-15 folder

skills.name: slim-governance
skills.description: Team governance templates for government-sponsored open source projects (small, medium, large teams)
skills.example: Add a governance model for our medium-sized team

skills.name: slim-issue-templates
skills.description: Add standardized GitHub issue templates for bug reports and feature requests in both Markdown and Form formats
skills.example: Add GitHub issue templates for bug reports and feature requests

skills.name: slim-license
skills.description: Detect project type and add appropriate NASA/Open Source licenses (Apache 2.0 or MIT)
skills.example: Add an Apache 2.0 license to this project

skills.name: slim-meeting-agenda
skills.description: Generate comprehensive meeting agendas by orchestrating context gathering from previous summaries, querying external services (GitHub, Slack, etc. via TECH.md), and matching custom format templates. Automatically identifies and suggests generation of missing meeting summaries.
skills.example: Create an agenda for tomorrow's sprint planning meeting

skills.name: slim-meeting-summary
skills.description: Generate comprehensive meeting summaries with action items from meeting notes, transcripts, or agendas. Automatically fulfills actionable tasks using tools discovered from TECH.md (MCP servers, APIs, local scripts) and provides guidance for manual tasks.
skills.example: Generate a meeting summary with action items from @meeting-transcript.md

skills.name: slim-project-aware-workspace
skills.description: Set up a project-aware workspace with date-organized dynamic folders for project-aware skill execution, tool integration tracking (MCP servers, APIs, scripts), and daily work organization
skills.example: Set up a new project-aware workspace

skills.name: slim-readme
skills.description: Create a comprehensive README.md template to help developers and users understand your project
skills.example: Create a comprehensive README for this project

skills.name: slim-skill-creator
skills.description: Meta-skill for creating and integrating new best practices (skills, agents, MCP servers) into the SLIM marketplace with dependency tracking and automated registry updates
skills.example: Help me create a new SLIM best practice for automated testing workflows

skills.name: slim-rebranding
skills.description: Comprehensive autonomous rebranding skill for projects. Handles all aspects of rebranding including text/naming, documentation, visual assets, colors/theming, and configuration files. Works with any codebase (Node, Python, Java, C++, Rust, Go, etc.). Auto-integrates free Phosphor icons. Presents detailed plan for approval before executing changes. Creates git branch and commits with clear messages. Validates changes with linters and build systems. Use when rebranding a project, changing project name, updating visual identity, or modernizing brand assets.
skills.example: Help me rebrand this slim website.

skills.name: slim-website-maker
skills.description: Autonomous website generator skill for creating customized Docusaurus documentation websites. Analyzes project content, generates intelligent website structure, and validates changes with iterative build testing until successful. Creates git branch and commits with clear messages. Auto-detects project type and customizes accordingly. Use when generating project documentation websites, creating content-driven sites, or automating website creation with build validation.
skills.example: Help me make a product website using SLIM best practices.

mcp.name: github-mcp-server
mcp.description: MCP server providing GitHub repository access and management capabilities including issues, PRs, and repository operations
mcp.example: Give me information about this repository from GitHub.
